heroHeadline: Sell Your Berry Bros. & Rudd Whisky
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for Berry's Own Selection single casks.
introParagraph: Berry Bros. & Rudd is Britain's oldest wine and spirit merchant (est. 1698). Their single cask whiskies are known for elegance, fruit-forward profiles, and impeccable selection.
photoChecklist: Front label showing Vintage and Cask #
Bottle shape (Tall wine style vs short)
conditionFactors: Label Style: 'Retro' labels (colorful, cartoony) from the 2000s are highly collectible.
Bottle Shape: BBR uses green/brown wine-style bottles. Check for glass color.
Fill: Generally stable, but check older releases.
pricingFactors: Distillery: Top tier distillers (Clynelish, Littlemill, Bowmore) in BBR livery sell well.
Blue Hanger: The numbered releases (e.g., Release 11) are collectible limited editions.
Exceptional Casks: High age, wood box releases.
Vintage: 1970s vintages are the sweet spot.

faqs.question: Do you buy Cutty Sark?
faqs.answer: Only the 25 Year Old or vintage 1970s bottlings. Not the standard yellow label.

faqs.question: What is Blue Hanger?
faqs.answer: A premium blended malt named after William Hanger. Early batches are valuable.

faqs.question: Do you buy 'The Perspective Series'?
faqs.answer: Yes, the photography label series (21, 25, 35, 40 Year) is excellent.

faqs.question: Is Berry's Own Selection valuable?
faqs.answer: The single casks are excellent. Value depends entirely on the distillery and age.

faqs.question: Do you buy Rum?
faqs.answer: Yes, Berry Bros. Rums (Jamaica, Guyana) are very popular.
